security_audit.summary: This skill is documentation-only for the GitHub CLI tool. All 55 static findings are false positives caused by the analyzer misinterpreting documentation metadata and GitHub terminology as security issues. The skill enables safe gh CLI command execution through the official GitHub CLI tool.

content.user_title: Automate GitHub workflows with gh CLI
content.value_statement: Managing GitHub repositories manually through the web interface is time-consuming and breaks your development flow. This skill enables seamless GitHub operations directly from your terminal using the gh CLI, automating PRs, issues, and workflows.
actual_capabilities: Create and manage pull requests with titles and descriptions
List and view issues with comment threads
Monitor CI/CD workflow runs and logs
Execute GitHub API calls for advanced operations
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) installed and authenticated
Only works with GitHub repositories (not GitLab or Bitbucket)
API rate limits apply to all operations

use_cases.title: Streamline PR workflow
use_cases.description: Create PRs, request reviews, and merge changes without leaving terminal

use_cases.title: Monitor CI/CD pipelines
use_cases.description: Check workflow status, view logs, and rerun failed jobs from command line

use_cases.title: Manage contributions
use_cases.description: Review issues, comment on PRs, and triage bug reports efficiently

prompt_templates.title: Create PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a pull request with title "Fix navigation bug" and description "Updates the header component to handle mobile menu toggle properly"

prompt_templates.title: List issues
prompt_templates.prompt: Show all open issues assigned to me in the current repository

prompt_templates.title: Check workflows
prompt_templates.prompt: List recent workflow runs and show any that failed

prompt_templates.title: API query
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the GitHub API to get all comments on pull request #123

best_practices: Always verify authentication with 'gh auth status' before operations
Use HEREDOC syntax for multi-line PR descriptions to preserve formatting
Check for uncommitted changes with 'git status' before creating PRs
anti_patterns: Never hardcode repository names in scripts - use variables instead
Avoid creating PRs without descriptions - always provide context
Do not ignore CI failures - check workflow status before merging

faq.question: Is this compatible with GitHub Enterprise?
faq.answer: Yes, the gh CLI works with GitHub Enterprise when properly configured

faq.question: What are the rate limits?
faq.answer: GitHub API allows 5000 requests per hour for authenticated users

faq.question: Can I use this with other Git platforms?
faq.answer: No, this skill is GitHub-specific and will not work with GitLab or Bitbucket

faq.question: Is my authentication token safe?
faq.answer: The gh CLI securely stores tokens locally, never exposed in commands

faq.question: Why is my command failing?
faq.answer: Check authentication with 'gh auth status' and ensure repository access

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub web?
faq.answer: CLI is faster for bulk operations and integrates with your development workflow
